2022年是迎難而上的一年。

2022年伊始，全球經濟環境一片暗淡。新冠病毒變異株Omicron肆虐，令全球經濟增長繼續受壓，通脹壓力亦持續上升。其後俄羅斯與烏克蘭爆發衝突，進一步推高通脹壓力，導致各主要央行採取前置式貨幣緊縮政策，擴大環球金融市場的波動，並加劇經濟增長放緩的風險。本地方面，第五波疫情爆發，感染個案急速上升，亦進一步打擊經濟。同時，圍繞防疫措施與檢疫限制的負面報道，更令外界對香港產生誤解，威脅香港作為國際金融中心的聲譽。全年計，香港實質本地生產總值收縮了3.5%。

儘管面對重重挑戰，金管局繼續致力保障香港貨幣與金融穩定，並於主要策略範疇推進多項有利發展的措施，進一步鞏固香港的國際金融中心地位。經歷3年的旅遊限制後，我們成功向國際社會展示香港已全面復常，旅客亦能再次親身訪港體驗。金管局在去年11月舉辦「國際金融領袖投資峰會」，來自世界各地的金融領袖親身來港出席。外界如此熱烈的反應，成為印證香港全面復常最好不過的證明。

展望未來，外圍環境仍然充滿前所未有的不確定性。儘管如此，內地經濟重啟會為香港以至整個地區重新注入動力。金管局將繼續緊守崗位，履行維持香港貨幣與銀行體系穩定的職能，並積極尋求更多有利香港發展的機會，展現及提升香港作為國際金融中心的競爭力。我們亦會繼續為提升全球氣候應變能力及可持續發展出力。今年除《二零二二年年報》外，我們會另外發表《二零二二年可持續發展報告》，以便更詳細地介紹金管局在提升香港作為綠色和可持續金融樞紐的地位所進行的各項工作，以及金管局作為負責任投資者及可持續機構所作出的努力。

# 貨幣及金融體系：堅穩如昔

聯繫匯率制度（聯匯制度）自1983年實施至今，歷經多個經濟周期，成功抵禦各種各樣的外來衝擊。2022年再次見證聯匯制度的抗震能力。在美國聯邦儲備局（聯儲局）大幅收緊貨幣政策下，弱方兌換保證於2022年5月至11月期間被觸發41次，金管局按照既定機制，以有序及具透明度的方式從市場買入合共2,421億港元。其間港元匯率及貨幣市場繼續運作暢順，反映聯匯制度穩健有效。

這份對聯匯制度的信心，來自於建立多年的穩固根基。正如國際貨幣基金組織在其《2022年對外部門報告》中重申，聯匯制度的公信力建基於多項因素，包括具高透明度的運作規則、充裕的外匯儲備、審慎的財政制度、穩健的金融監管，以及靈活的經濟結構。

我們深信除了穩健的機制外，致力與公眾及市場溝通以加深其對聯匯制度的了解、進行有效的市場監察，以及就不同情景作出應變計劃，均有助鞏固各界對聯匯制度的信心。我們就聯匯制度運作機制推出的社交媒體宣傳活動，有助在年內弱方兌換保證多次被觸發的情況下，有效維護市場對聯匯制度的信心。內部方面，金管局亦善用數據分析技術加強市場監察，讓我們能適時回應最新市場形勢。

年內，儘管面對宏觀層面的挑戰以及遞增的信用風險，香港銀行體系仍然維持穩健，資本及流動性均非常充裕。2022年底，本地銀行的綜合總資本充足比率為20.1%，遠高於國際最低要求的8%。2022年第4季，大型銀行的流動性覆蓋比率稍升至162.3%，亦遠高於法定最低要求的100%。鑑於信貸環境面對挑戰，銀行體系的資產質素略為轉差，特定分類貸款比率於2022年底升至1.38%，但有關水平仍屬穩健，並低於2000年以來的長期平均水平1.8%。

# 銀行體系：有效監管確保運作穩健

疫情持續3年，來自各方面的挑戰均有所加劇，例如地緣政治緊張局勢升溫及主要央行收緊貨幣政策。然而，全賴多年來妥善的風險管理及有效的監管，香港銀行體系得以維持穩健，繼續發揮支持經濟的重要作用。

過去一年面對的一項主要監管挑戰，是在第五波新冠疫情後經濟仍充滿不確定性之下，確保銀行繼續為客戶提供所需支援的同時，維持穩健的信用風險管理。「預先批核還息不還本」計劃進一步展期，並加入自願性部分本金還款選項，讓借款人可以選擇開始償還部分本金，協助客戶就最終回復正常還款作好準備。

因應主要經濟體大幅收緊貨幣政策令市場波動加劇，2022年金管局另一項主要監管工作是加強監察銀行的市場及流動性風險承擔。我們深入評估各經濟體同步收緊貨幣政策對銀行可能產生的影響，並就壓力測試引入新情景，以評估銀行應對長時間流動性壓力的韌性。

與此同時，我們繼續採取具前瞻性的措施，促進在多個範疇的有效風險管理。在運作穩健性及網絡防衛能力方面，我們提供指引協助銀行制定綜合及全面的運作架構，以達致穩健經營，並就銀行具體的運作範疇提供詳盡監管指引，例如因應雲端技術普及而就使用雲端運算提供指引。此外，因應數碼化加速發展，我們亦加強了應對「網絡釣魚」騙案和推進消費者及投資者保障的工作。

除了維持銀行體系穩健外，金管局亦致力推動普及金融及提高銀行服務的便利性。銀行對於金管局就提供基本銀行服務的呼籲反應正面，有銀行在新發展地區的大型公共屋邨增設分行及自助銀行服務設施。受到疫情相關的旅遊限制影響，許多香港市民無法使用其內地銀行戶口。有見及此，金管局與有關各方緊密合作，協助重新啓動約50萬個內地銀行戶口，受影響戶口持有人無需親身前往內地辦理。

另一個對銀行業持續發展具策略重要性的範疇是提升專業能力。為擴展業務，銀行業對專業人才的需求仍然龐大。金管局在其人才發展策略 — 「連接人才與未來」— 的基礎上，在過去一年推出多項措施，協助銀行業吸引、培育及挽留人才，集中提升及再培訓現有從業員的技能，以及培育年輕一代，以建立可持續的人才庫。

# 國際金融中心：香港重回國際舞台!

實施多時的疫情相關旅遊限制於2022年逐步撤銷，我們作出了多方面的努力讓香港重回國際舞台。11月舉行的「國際金融領袖投資峰會」吸引超過200位來自環球金融機構的國際及地區負責人親臨香港，並獲得全球各地的關注及熱切迴響。儘管峰會舉行日期不巧遇上50年來首個在11月份發出的8號颱風訊號，峰會仍然十分成功，向世界傳遞了香港已全面復常並正展現無比朝氣與活力的有力訊息。我們很高興看到峰會產生了正面的漣漪效應，不少環球金融機構及國際組織現正或計劃在香港舉辦各類活動。

除吸引各地訪客重臨香港外，我和金管局的同事體會到面對面交流聯繫的重要性，因此盡可能親身代表香港出席主要國際會議，積極參與全球政策討論，並藉外訪機會與環球金融機構的集團管理層會面，加深他們對香港穩健的金融體系以及在「一國兩制」下香港提供的各種機遇的了解。

為確保香港保持作為國際金融中心的競爭力，我們在金融科技、內地機遇，以及綠色和可持續金融等策略性重點領域不斷開拓市場新界限。我們亦進一步加強本港的金融平台，提供頂尖的服務，吸引更多企業落戶香港。有關金管局在綠色和可持續金融方面的工作詳情，請參閱《二零二二年可持續發展報告》。

# 金融科技

繼2021年6月公布「金融科技2025」策略，2022年我們在五大範疇均取得顯著進展。

我們在「全面推展銀行數碼化」方面的工作取得理想成果。根據金融科技應用評估的結果，香港銀行業在不同業務領域廣泛採用金融科技，而且所採用的科技類別亦持續增加。我們自2017年以來逐步推廣及支持數碼化的工作獲銀行積極回應，並持續取得成果，成續令人鼓舞。我們將繼續與業界緊密合作，根據評估的結果，進一步推動金融科技在特定銀行業務領域的應用及促進個別科技類別的發展。

年內我們在央行數碼貨幣方面的工作邁進重要的新里程。「多種央行數碼貨幣跨境網絡」(mBridge)項目進入試行階段，並成為全球其中一個率先為企業跨境交易進行真實結算的央行數碼貨幣項目。在零售層面，數字人民幣跨境使用的技術測試已進入第二階段，主要測試通過「轉數快」為數字人民幣錢包增值。數碼港元方面，我們將採取三軌道方式為將來可能發行數碼港元作好準備，並推出第二軌道先導計劃，邀請業界深入研究數碼港元可行的應用場景。

數據可全面釋放金融科技的潛力。我們於去年10月推出的「商業數據通」正是提升香港數據基建的重要一步。作為以數據擁有人授權為本的共享數據基建，「商業數據通」能方便金融機構提取企業的商業數據，使企業（尤其中小型企業）更容易獲得融資。截至2022年底，「商業數據通」已促成超過1,000宗中小企貸款，總額逾19億港元。

最後，我們在擁抱金融創新和它帶來的好處的同時，亦明白有必要監察及處理好相關發展可能帶來的風險。我們正密切注視虛擬資產領域的發展，並參與相關監管事宜的國際討論。經考慮公眾諮詢收集到的意見及相關國際標準後，我們將採納「相同風險，相同監管」1 的方式制定穩定幣的監管制度及界定其監管範圍。未來我們率先規管的對象將是那些標榜與一種或以上法定貨幣的價值掛鈎的穩定幣，因為這類穩定幣可能對貨幣及金融穩定帶來更高及更迫切的潛在風險。我們相信在訂立適當的規範下，業界將可更安全穩妥地開拓數碼金融的潛力。

科技正重塑我們的未來。金管局與銀行業界正積極準備迎向這個「新常態」。我們有信心我們正構建的金融科技生態圈將有助全面釋放金融科技的潛力，並提升香港作為國際金融中心的競爭力。

2022 was a year of meeting challenges head-on.

At the beginning of 2022, the global economic environment remained bleak. The Omicron variant of the COVID-19 virus spread widely, continuing to pressure global economic growth and inflation. Subsequently, the conflict between Russia and Ukraine further intensified inflation pressures, prompting major central banks to implement preemptive monetary tightening policies, increasing volatility in global financial markets and exacerbating the risks of economic slowdown. Locally, the fifth wave of the pandemic broke out, leading to a rapid rise in infection cases and further undermining the economy. Meanwhile, negative media coverage surrounding epidemic prevention measures and quarantine restrictions fueled misunderstandings about Hong Kong, threatening its reputation as an international financial centre. Throughout the year, Hong Kong's real GDP contracted by 3.5%.

Despite these formidable challenges, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) continued to strive to safeguard Hong Kong's currency and financial stability, advancing various development-oriented initiatives across key strategic areas to further consolidate Hong Kong's status as an international financial centre. After three years of travel restrictions, we successfully demonstrated to the international community that Hong Kong had fully reopened, allowing visitors to experience the city firsthand. The HKMA hosted the International Financial Leaders' Investment Summit in November last year, which attracted financial leaders from around the world to attend in person. Such enthusiastic responses from the outside world served as compelling evidence of Hong Kong's full recovery.

Looking ahead, the external environment remains fraught with unprecedented uncertainty. Despite this, the resumption of the mainland economy will inject new momentum into Hong Kong and the entire region. The HKMA will continue to fulfill its role in maintaining the stability of Hong Kong's currency and banking system, actively seeking more opportunities for Hong Kong's development, and demonstrating and enhancing Hong Kong's competitiveness as an international financial centre. We will also continue our efforts to improve global climate resilience and sustainability. In addition to the Annual Report 2022, we will issue a separate Sustainable Development Report 2022 this year, providing a more detailed overview of the HKMA's work in promoting Hong Kong's position as a green and sustainable financial hub, as well as the HKMA's efforts as a responsible investor and sustainable institution.

## Currency and Financial System: As Solid as Ever

The Linked Exchange Rate System (LERs), implemented since 1983, has withstood numerous economic cycles and various external shocks. 2022 once again demonstrated the system's resilience. Under the US Federal Reserve's significant monetary tightening, the weak-side exchange guarantee was triggered 41 times between May and November 2022, during which the HKMA purchased a total of HKD 242.1 billion from the market through the established mechanism in an orderly and transparent manner. During this period, the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate and money market continued to operate smoothly, reflecting the soundness and effectiveness of the LER system.

This confidence in the LER system stems from its long-established solid foundation. As reiterated by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) in its 2022 Article IV Consultation Report, the credibility of the LER system is based on multiple factors, including highly transparent operating rules, ample foreign exchange reserves, prudent fiscal policies, sound financial regulation, and a flexible economic structure.

We believe that besides the sound mechanism, efforts to communicate with the public and market participants to enhance their understanding of the LER system, conduct effective market surveillance, and prepare contingency plans for different scenarios also contribute to bolstering confidence in the system. Our social media campaign promoting the operational mechanisms of the LER system effectively maintained market confidence despite the multiple triggers of the weak-side exchange guarantee throughout the year. Internally, the HKMA also leveraged data analytics technology to strengthen market monitoring, enabling us to respond promptly to evolving market conditions.

Throughout the year, despite macro-level challenges and increasing credit risks, the banking system remained robust with ample capital and liquidity. At the end of 2022, the comprehensive capital adequacy ratio of local banks reached 20.1%, far exceeding the international minimum requirement of 8%. In the fourth quarter of 2022, the liquidity coverage ratio of large banks slightly increased to 162.3%, significantly higher than the statutory minimum of 100%. Given the challenging credit environment, the quality of bank assets showed slight deterioration, with the classified loan ratio rising to 1.38% by the end of 2022. However, this level remained stable and lower than the long-term average of 1.8% since 2000.

## Banking System: Effective Regulation Ensures Steady Operations

With the pandemic continuing for three years, challenges from all sides have escalated, including intensified geopolitical tensions and tight monetary policies by major central banks. Nevertheless, thanks to years of effective risk management and regulation, the Hong Kong banking system remained robust and continued to play its crucial role in supporting the economy.

One of the main regulatory challenges faced over the past year was ensuring banks could provide necessary support to customers while maintaining sound credit risk management amid ongoing uncertainties following the fifth wave of the pandemic. The Pre-approved Interest-only Payment Scheme was extended further and included voluntary options for partial principal repayment, allowing borrowers to choose to start repaying part of the principal, assisting clients in preparing for the eventual return to normal repayments.

In response to the exacerbated market fluctuations caused by the sharp tightening of monetary policies in major economies, another primary regulatory task for the HKMA in 2022 was to monitor banks' exposure to market and liquidity risks more closely. We conducted in-depth assessments of the potential impacts of synchronized monetary tightening across economies on banks, and introduced new stress testing scenarios to evaluate banks' resilience against prolonged liquidity pressures.

Meanwhile, we continued to adopt proactive measures to promote effective risk management across multiple areas. Regarding operational resilience and cybersecurity capabilities, we provided guidance to help banks establish comprehensive and thorough operational frameworks for steady operations, and offered detailed regulatory guidelines for specific operational domains, such as cloud computing guidance due to the widespread adoption of cloud technologies. Additionally, in response to accelerated digitalization, we enhanced our efforts against phishing scams and consumer and investor protection.

Beyond maintaining the banking system's strength, the HKMA is also committed to promoting financial inclusion and improving the convenience of banking services. Banks responded positively to the HKMA's call for providing basic banking services, with some establishing branch offices and automated teller machines in large public housing estates in newly developed areas. Due to pandemic-related travel restrictions, many Hong Kong residents were unable to access their Mainland bank accounts. In response, the HKMA worked closely with relevant parties to reactivate approximately 500,000 Mainland bank accounts, without requiring account holders to visit Mainland China in person.

Another strategically important area for sustained banking sector development is enhancing professional capabilities. To expand business operations, the banking industry continues to face significant demand for professional talent. Building upon the HKMA's talent development strategy "Connecting Talent with the Future," we launched several measures in the past year to assist the banking sector in attracting, cultivating, and retaining talent, focusing on upskilling and retraining existing employees and nurturing the younger generation to build a sustainable talent pool.

## International Financial Centre: Hong Kong Reclaims Its Place on the Global Stage

The long-standing pandemic-related travel restrictions were gradually lifted in 2022, and we made extensive efforts to reintegrate Hong Kong onto the global stage. The "International Financial Leaders' Investment Summit" held in November attracted over 200 international and regional executives from global financial institutions to attend in person, receiving wide attention and enthusiastic responses worldwide. Although the summit coincided with the first-ever typhoon signal No. 8 issued in November in 50 years, it still achieved great success, conveying a strong message that Hong Kong has fully recovered and is showing immense vitality and energy. We are pleased to see the positive ripple effect generated by the summit, with many global financial institutions and international organizations currently holding or planning to hold various events in Hong Kong.

Apart from attracting visitors back to Hong Kong, I and my colleagues at the HKMA recognize the importance of face-to-face interactions, so we have made every effort to represent Hong Kong at major international conferences, actively participate in global policy discussions, and meet with senior management of global financial institutions during overseas visits to deepen their understanding of Hong Kong's resilient financial system and the various opportunities available under the "one country, two systems" framework.

To ensure Hong Kong maintains its competitive edge as an international financial centre, we continuously explore new frontiers in strategic priority areas such as fintech, mainland opportunities, and green and sustainable finance. We also further strengthen Hong Kong's financial platform, offering top-notch services to attract more enterprises to set up operations in Hong Kong. Details of the HKMA's work in green and sustainable finance can be found in the Sustainable Development Report 2022.

## Fintech

Following the announcement of the "Fintech 2025" strategy in June 2021, we achieved significant progress in five key areas in 2022.

Our work in "comprehensively advancing banking digitization" yielded satisfactory results. According to the assessment of fintech applications, the banking industry in Hong Kong extensively adopted fintech across different business areas, with the types of technologies used continuing to increase. Since 2017, our gradual promotion and support of digitalization have been actively responded to by the banking industry, yielding continuous results that are encouraging. We will continue to work closely with the industry, based on the assessment findings, to further promote the application of fintech in specific banking sectors and foster the development of individual technology categories.

During the year, we made significant progress in central bank digital currency (CBDC) research. The multilateral CBDC bridge (mBridge) project entered the trial phase and became one of the first global CBDC projects to conduct real-world settlements for corporate cross-border transactions. On the retail side, the technological trials for cross-border use of the Digital Yuan entered the second phase, primarily testing the process of topping up Digital Yuan wallets via the Fast Transfer System. For the Digital Hong Kong Dollar, we adopted a three-track approach to prepare for the possible issuance of a digital Hong Kong Dollar, and launched the second-track pilot programme, inviting the industry to deeply investigate feasible application scenarios for the Digital Hong Kong Dollar.

Data is essential to unleashing the full potential of fintech. The launch of the "Business Data Gateway" in October last year marked an important step in enhancing Hong Kong's data infrastructure. As a data-sharing infrastructure based on data owner authorization, the Business Data Gateway enables financial institutions to easily extract commercial data from companies, making it easier for businesses (particularly small and medium-sized enterprises) to obtain financing. By the end of 2022, the Business Data Gateway had facilitated over 1,000 SME loans amounting to more than HKD 1.9 billion.

Finally, while embracing financial innovation and its benefits, we recognize the necessity to monitor and address the potential risks associated with these developments. We are closely observing developments in the virtual asset sector and participating in international discussions on related regulatory matters. After considering the opinions gathered from public consultations and relevant international standards, we will adopt the principle of "same risk, same regulation" to establish a regulatory framework for stablecoins and define their regulatory scope. In the future, our initial focus will be on stablecoins that claim to be pegged to the value of one or more fiat currencies, as these stablecoins may pose higher and more urgent potential risks to monetary and financial stability. We believe that with appropriate regulations in place, the industry can safely and steadily explore the potential of digital finance.

Technology is reshaping our future. The HKMA and the banking industry are proactively preparing for this "new normal." We are confident that the fintech ecosystem we are building will fully unlock the potential of fintech and enhance Hong Kong's competitiveness as an international financial centre.

# 2022年摘要

# 經濟及金融環境

受第五波新冠病毒疫情、金融狀況收緊及充滿挑戰的外圍環境等多項不利因素的影響，香港經濟在2022年顯著收縮。勞工市場首先轉差，其後逐步改善，而通脹則維持溫和。受惠於內地與香港全面通關，預計2023年香港經濟增長將由低位復甦。

香港銀行體系在2022年繼續保持穩健，資本及流動性狀況維持充裕，資產質素繼續處於健康水平。

# 貨幣穩定

隨着美國收緊貨幣政策，港元轉弱，弱方兌換保證於年內被多次觸發。然而，港元外匯及貨幣市場繼續保持有序及暢順運作，一再證明聯繫匯率制度穩健有效。

# 儲備管理

2022年的投資環境異常動盪，多種資產類別的價格同時下挫，外匯基金錄得整體投資回報率為負4.5%，與市場上大部分多元資產基金的表現相比，虧損幅度相對溫和。

金管局亦繼續致力推動負責任投資及資產多元化。與此同時，長期增長組合自2009年開展投資以來的內部回報率年率為12.6%。

# 銀行體系穩定

面對金融市場波動擴大，金管局加強對銀行的信用及市場風險管理的監管，並與銀行緊密合作，提升銀行的運作穩健性及網絡防衛能力，以應對網絡威脅持續增加及銀行業數碼轉型步伐加快的情況。

金管局進一步推出有關「先買後付」產品及新增物業轉按支付安排的消費者保障措施。此外，金管局與其他監管機構合作制定虛擬資產監管架構，並就分銷投資產品發出指引及推出全新的信託業務監管制度。有關個人信貸資料的「多間信貸資料服務機構」模式下的「信貸資料平台」亦於年內啟用。

金管局繼續與銀行合作提升香港的打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集（反洗錢）生態系統，並加強對騙案的回應措施，又透過「反洗錢合規科技實驗室」系列進一步推動數據與科技的應用，以及加快金管局就反洗錢工作採用監管科技的步伐。

金管局在本地實施有關資本充足標準及披露標準等國際監管標準方面取得良好進展。金管局亦與銀行業共同為未來發展努力建立可持續的人才庫及提升從業員的技能。

為確保香港備有具公信力的處置機制，金管局制定新處置標準，又進行地區危機模擬演習，並在所有具本地系統重要性銀行建立一層新的吸收虧損能力資源，為處置機制的發展立下重要的里程碑。

# 香港的國際金融中心地位

「國際金融領袖投資峰會」取得成功，鞏固香港的國際金融中心地位，並製造正面的漣漪效應。

中國人民銀行與金管局之間的貨幣互換協議於年內優化，進一步鞏固香港作為全球離岸人民幣業務樞紐的地位。金管局亦與其他監管機構及持份者合作，籌備開通「互換通」，及推出配合人民幣計價股票在港交易的雙櫃台莊家機制。另又致力發展債務工具中央結算系統成為亞洲區主要的國際中央證券託管平台。

在加強香港金融平台的競爭力方面取得良好進展，涵蓋債券發行、資產及財富管理、企業財資中心，以及綠色和可持續金融等範疇。

金管局亦繼續推行「金融科技2025」策略，促進金融業界採用金融科技，並提升香港作為金融科技樞紐的地位。快速支付系統「轉數快」隨着功能提升，使用量穩步增長。

# 機構職能

金管局透過不同渠道與社會及市場保持有效聯繫，提升公眾對金管局政策及工作的了解。

對內，金管局悉心建立一支強調靈活應變及可持續發展的工作團隊，同時遵守嚴格的財政紀律及提升資訊科技能力，應對變化及確保有效執行各項政策及措施。

# 2022 Summary

# Economic and Financial Environment

Due to multiple adverse factors including the fifth wave of the COVID-19 pandemic, tightened financial conditions, and a challenging external environment, Hong Kong's economy contracted significantly in 2022. The labor market initially deteriorated but gradually improved, while inflation remained moderate. With the comprehensive resumption of border crossings between mainland China and Hong Kong, it is expected that Hong Kong's economic growth will rebound from low levels in 2023.

The banking system continued to maintain soundness in 2022, with capital and liquidity positions remaining adequate and asset quality continuing to be in healthy condition.

# Currency Stability

With the tightening of US monetary policy, the Hong Kong dollar weakened, resulting in repeated triggers of the weak-side exchange guarantee during the year. However, the foreign exchange and money markets remained orderly and smoothly operated, once again demonstrating the robust effectiveness of the Linked Exchange Rate System.

# Reserve Management

Investment environments in 2022 were unusually volatile, with price declines across various asset classes simultaneously. The Exchange Fund recorded an overall investment return of -4.5%, which was relatively modest compared to the performance of most multi-asset funds in the market.

The HKMA continued to promote responsible investing and asset diversification. At the same time, the internal rate of return for the Long-term Growth Portfolio since its inception in 2009 has been 12.6% annually.

# Banking System Stability

Faced with expanding financial market volatility, the HKMA enhanced oversight of banks' credit and market risk management, and worked closely with banks to improve their operational resilience and network defense capabilities to address increasing cyber threats and accelerated digital transformation in the banking sector.

The HKMA further introduced consumer protection measures regarding "buy now, pay later" products and new mortgage refinancing arrangements. Meanwhile, the HKMA collaborated with other regulators to develop a regulatory framework for virtual assets, issued guidelines on distributing investment products, and launched a new trust business regulatory regime. The "Credit Data Platform" under the "Multi-Data Service Providers" model for personal credit information was also implemented during the year.

The HKMA continues to work with banks to enhance Hong Kong's anti-money laundering and counter-terrorist financing (AML/CFT) ecosystem, strengthen response measures against fraud, and further advance the application of data and technology through the AML Compliance Technology Innovation Lab series, accelerating the adoption of regulatory technology for AML activities.

The HKMA made positive progress in implementing international regulatory standards such as capital adequacy and disclosure requirements. It also collaborates with the banking industry to build a sustainable talent pool and enhance staff skills for future development.

To ensure Hong Kong has a credible resolution mechanism, the HKMA formulated new resolution standards, conducted regional crisis simulation exercises, and established an additional layer of loss-absorbing capacity resources in all locally significant banks, marking an important milestone in the development of the resolution mechanism.

# Hong Kong's Position as an International Financial Centre

The successful "International Financial Leaders' Investment Summit" reinforced Hong Kong's position as an international financial centre and created a positive ripple effect.

The Renminbi (RMB) swap agreement between the People's Bank of China and the HKMA was optimized during the year, further solidifying Hong Kong's status as a global RMB offshore business hub. The HKMA also collaborated with other regulators and stakeholders to prepare for the launch of "Swap Connect" and introduce a dual-trading counterparty mechanism to support RMB-denominated stock trading in Hong Kong. Additionally, it continues to develop the Debt Securities Central Clearing System into a major international central securities depository platform in Asia.

Good progress has been made in enhancing Hong Kong's financial platform competitiveness, covering areas such as bond issuance, asset and wealth management, corporate treasury centres, and green and sustainable finance.

The HKMA continues to implement its "FinTech 2025" strategy, promoting the adoption of FinTech by the financial industry and enhancing Hong Kong's status as a FinTech hub. The Faster Payment System "Octopus" has seen steady usage growth following functional upgrades.

# Institutional Functions

The HKMA maintains effective communication channels with society and the market to enhance public understanding of its policies and operations.

Internally, the HKMA is committed to building a flexible and sustainable workforce while adhering to strict fiscal discipline and enhancing IT capabilities to respond to changes and ensure the effective implementation of all policies and measures.

金管局公布優化人民幣流動資金安排，包括擴大規模及簡化操作。

金管局與證券及期貨事務監察委員會（證監會）發出聯合通函，就中介人從事虛擬資產相關活動提供更新指引以保障客戶。

金管局就銀行管理與虛擬資產及虛擬資產服務提供者相關的洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集風險的監管指引作出更新。

# 2月23日

金管局聯同「銀行業中小企貸款協調機制」宣布，延長「預先批核還息不還本」計劃6個月至10月底，貿易融資貸款本金還款期則可獲延長90天。計劃亦同時提供一個為期一年的部分本金還款選項，讓有意願和有能力的借款人逐步回復正常還款。

金管局及保險業監管局（保監局）推出措施就利用保費融資投購人壽保單加強客戶保障。

# 4月14日

金管局就協助香港市民在因疫情而實施的檢疫限制下重新啟動其內地銀行帳戶，向香港銀行發出指引。

# 4月28日

金管局宣布與銀行業聯合推出「銀行業畢業生培訓計劃」，為銀行業的快速增長領域擴大人才庫。

金管局認可由香港銀行公會（銀行公會）和接受存款公司公會將實施的「強制性背景查核計劃」，旨在處理香港銀行業中「滾動的壞蘋果」現象。

「百分百擔保個人特惠貸款計劃」開始接受個別受暫緩追討欠租安排影響的業主申請，直至10月31日。

金管局發表《零售銀行前線部門獎勵制度專題評估》的報告（英文版），以持續推動銀行業穩善文化。

# 5月27日

金管局發出《信託業務營運守則》及相關的《監管政策手冊》新單元，以加強規管與監管香港信託業務。

按揭證券公司全資擁有的香港年金有限公司宣布，香港年金計劃推出優化措施及推廣優惠。優化措施包括提高「醫療和牙科開支特別款項提取」金額上限及個人保費總金額上限。

金管局發布金融科技應用評估的結果及相關工作計劃，以進一步支持業界應用金融科技。

# 7月1日

為實施巴塞爾委員會的「銀行於基金的股權投資的資本要求」而制定的《2022年銀行業（資本）（修訂）規則》生效。

金管局根據政府發表的《2022年香港洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集風險評估報告》所概述的主要見解及相關影響，向銀行及儲值支付工具持牌人發出指引。

金管局歡迎銀行公會公布就住宅物業轉按交易提供多一種支付安排予客戶選擇。按揭銀行於11月7日開始提供該項新增的物業交易支付安排。

金管局與數碼港在德勤協助下，合辦第二次「反洗錢合規科技實驗室(AMLab 2)，主要聚焦門檻較低及容易落實的「易用科技」。

# 9月2日

金管局就銀行的「先買後付」產品推出一系列消費者保護措施，以推動負責任借貸。

# 9月8日

金管局宣布推出一站式網上資源平台「銀行業導航」及第二屆「銀行業銜接課程」。

金管局聯同「銀行業中小企貸款協調機制」宣布，延長「預先批核還息不還本」計劃3個月至2023年1月底。

金管局敲定「金融科技從業員培訓資助先導計劃」的實施細則，並正式在銀行業界啟動計劃。

證監會與金管局發表有關持牌法團和註冊機構銷售非交易所買賣投資產品的第二次年度聯合調查結果，共有327間持牌法團及63間註冊機構呈報它們在2021年內銷售投資產品的相關數據，總交易額達50,150億港元，參與的投資者增加5%至770,000名。

金管局在「銀行專業資歷架構」下推出「合規」單元，與銀行業界合作制定一套可供業界共同採用和具透明度的能力標準，以提升從事合規工作的從業員的專業能力。

金管局聯同銀行公會、銀行及儲值支付工具業界支持香港警務處推出詐騙陷阱搜尋器「防騙視伏器」，以加強預防、偵測及制止社會上的詐騙行為及減少公眾的財務損失。

# 10月20日

金管局聯同「銀行業中小企貸款協調機制」宣布，延長「預先批核還息不還本」計劃6個月至2023年7月底，並優化部分本金還款選項，協助有能力的企業準備日後逐步回復正常還款。

按揭證券公司宣布與14間合作銀行簽訂基建貸款合作框架《諒解備忘錄》，就基建貸款上的合作定立主要準則。

# 2023年工作重點及前瞻

儘管香港經濟在2023 年初出現復甦跡象，但外圍環境仍然充滿挑戰及不確定性。近期美國和歐洲的銀行業受壓，個別美國本土銀行在2023 年3 月倒閉，對環球金融市場造成漣漪效應，而主要央行收緊貨幣政策，很有可能令2023 年全球經濟增長放緩甚或衰退。另一方面，地緣政治局勢緊張，以及去全球化的威脅持續，可能會繼續拖累全球貿易，並會令環球金融市場不時出現波動。儘管如此，香港金融體系憑藉多年來所建立穩健的抗震能力及充裕的緩衝，有足夠能力抵禦不利衝擊。

金管局非常重視保障貨幣及金融穩定。展望未來，面對不明朗的宏觀經濟環境，金管局會保持警惕，力求迅速辨識正浮現的風險，並靈活應對。與此同時，金管局會繼續把握機遇及創造政策空間，進一步提升香港作為主要國際金融中心的地位。面對充滿挑戰的投資環境，金管局在管理外匯基金時會繼續審慎投資，同時保持足夠靈活性，按需要採取防禦措施，並維持高流動性。

# 金融體系保持穩定健全

環球經濟前景仍受制於重大的不確定因素。金管局會密切注視最新發展，提高警覺，防範各種潛在風險，以維持金融體系穩定健全；這是關乎持續提供關鍵金融服務的先決條件，因此亦是維繫香港經濟正常運作的命脈。

# 對潛在風險保持警惕

在2023年，美國利率未來走勢的不確定性，以及在先進經濟體銀行體系出現的壓力，可能會對主要先進經濟體的增長前景帶來下行風險。此外，持續的地緣政治風險，可能會繼續拖累全球貿易，並會令環球金融市場不時出現波動。然而，香港金融體系憑藉過去多年所建立的抗震能力及緩衝，有足夠能力抵禦不利衝擊。金管局亦有能力、資源及決心維持香港貨幣及金融穩定。

金管局將繼續密切注視本地及外圍環境的風險與脆弱性，並會按需要採取適當措施維持香港的貨幣及金融體系穩定。金管局亦會研究對香港經濟有影響的事項，以及評估與這些事項相關的潛在風險。

# 保持銀行體系穩定

鑑於地緣政治緊張局勢升級，以及各主要央行大幅加息以遏抑通脹，預計2023年銀行業的經營環境仍然充滿挑戰。另一方面，科技發展迅速及數碼化對銀行業來說既有危又有機。面對瞬息萬變的金融環境，金管局致力透過持續的監管工作確保銀行具足夠能力抵禦衝擊。與此同時，金管局亦會參照國際標準及最佳做法，繼續加強及優化銀行監管架構與政策。

# 風險為本的監管重點

# 信用、流動性及市場風險

在2023年，金管局將繼續密切注視認可機構的資產質素，並聚焦於認可機構的貸款分類及撥備做法，以及對財務狀況較差的借款人的管理。金管局亦會加強其監察系統，並採取積極措施確保銀行體系的整體信用風險水平維持可控。

另一方面，金管局會繼續留意企業的營運環境，並與銀行業及商界保持緊密溝通，以就最終退出「預先批核還息不還本」計劃作好準備，並同時確保暫時面對困難的客戶仍然得到適切的信貸支援。

此外，面對不明朗的宏觀經濟環境，金管局於2023年亦會加強監管認可機構的流動性及市場風險管理。

# 業務操作及科技風險

隨着銀行在業務營運中更廣泛應用科技，金管局會致力提升銀行業的運作穩健性及網絡防衛能力。繼5月發出《監管政策手冊》新單元「運作穩健性」後，金管局會與業界保持緊密聯繫，審視認可機構在制定運作穩健性框架方面的進度。同時，金管局將透過跟進認可機構在「網絡防衛評估框架2.0」評估下發現的問題以及檢視認可機構實施穩固三重數據備份的進展，提高銀行業的網絡防衛能力。

隨着數碼化的步伐加快，金管局的其他監管重點包括加強對銀行的第三方服務供應商風險管理的監管，以及提升銀行業的數據管治能力。

# 打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集

在2023年，金管局的工作重點包括更新監管資訊、加強打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集（反洗錢）生態系統各持份者的合作以應對洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集（洗錢）風險，以及進一步推動反洗錢監管科技與合規科技的發展。金管局的《打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集指引》亦會作出修訂，並會就「政治人物」採取與風險相稱的措施發出具體指引，從而促進業界以有效及風險為本的方法落實法例的主要修訂。與此同時，金管局會擴大現有公私營夥伴合作的涵蓋範圍以加強訊息共享，以及支持推出銀行之間的訊息共享平台，藉以加快偵測可疑戶口及防範戶口被濫用，並加強對騙案受害人的保障和協助受害人追討損失。金管局亦會透過「反洗錢合規科技實驗室」及其他反洗錢合規科技項目，進一步集中推動採用合規科技（包括數據分析），並致力發展宏觀分析能力，以配合其數據為本的反洗錢監管工作。透過實施上述各項措施，金管局將能更迅速針對傀儡戶口網絡等系統性洗錢風險採取相應措施，以及靈活應對不斷轉變的威脅。

# 財富管理業務

金管局在2023年會加強有關認可機構在財富管理以及銷售證券、強制性公積金（強積金）與其他投資及保險產品方面的操守的現場審查及非現場監察。2023年的重點將會是「跨境理財通」計劃、數碼分銷及諮詢平台、虛擬資產、環境、社會及管治(ESG)投資產品及長期保險產品。金管局在有關過程中會參考市場最新發展及國際標準的修訂。

金管局亦會與其他監管機構及銀行界緊密聯繫，並按需要就銷售投資、保險及強積金產品的監管標準向認可機構提供指引，其中亦會包括有關提供虛擬資產相關投資服務的指引。就此而言，為促進虛擬資產行業可持續及負責任地發展，金管局會積極參與相關國際組織，並與政府及其他金融監管機構合作，制定全面的虛擬資產監管架構。

隨着「跨境理財通」順利推出，金管局會與業界及相關監管機構聯繫，以優化該計劃。此外，金管局亦會與證券及期貨事務監察委員會（證監會）及業界合作，精簡投資產品銷售程序（包括適用於資深投資者的銷售程序），以及開始根據相關《監管政策手冊》新單元及新營運守則監管認可機構的信託業務。

# 監察金融市場基建

金管局的目標是按照《支付系統及儲值支付工具條例》（《支付條例》）、《金融市場基建的原則》（《基建原則》），以及支付及金融基建委員會發出的各項指引促進其所監察的金融市場基建的安全及效率，按需要參照最新的國際標準評估各項基建。金管局會參與支付及金融基建委員會與國際證監會組織對實施《基建原則》的監察及評估計劃，亦會參與國際標準制定組織的工作，並參照國際慣例或因應市場及科技發展加強本身的監察規定。同時，如有需要，金管局會與有關當局合作，進一步加強合作監察安排。

# 制定政策

金管局會因應國際標準及最佳做法，繼續加強及優化銀行監管架構與政策。

# 在香港實施巴塞爾標準

# 資本標準

金管局會透過實施巴塞爾銀行監管委員會（巴塞爾委員會）近年發布的標準，進一步優化資本框架，當中包括：
- 2017年12月《巴塞爾協定三：危機後改革的最終方案》、2019年1月（2019年2月修訂）《市場風險最低資本規定》，以及2020年7月《信用估值調整風險架構具針對性的修訂》所載的經修訂資本標準 — 上述經修訂資本標準統稱《巴塞爾協定三》最終改革方案，載明信用風險、市場風險、信用估值調整風險及業務操作風險的新監管處理方法，並引入出項下限規定，以及優化槓桿比率框架。經過2022年的多輪業界諮詢後，金管局計劃在2023年就《銀行業（資本）規則》（《資本規則》）的建議修訂進行法定諮詢，以實施上述各項規定及正值中性逆周期緩衝資本。有關修訂預計於同年內提交立法會進行先訂立後審議程序，並不早於2024年1月1日生效，作為最低要求。
- 2022年12月《加密資產風險承擔的審慎處理方法》金管局計劃按照巴塞爾委員會的時間表，在2025年1月1日於本地實施有關標準，並打算於2023年就相關建議諮詢業界。

# 風險承擔限度

金管局於2023年3月就《銀行業（風險承擔限度）規則》的建議修訂諮詢業界。有關建議修訂主要是因應金管局實施上文提及的《巴塞爾協定三》最終改革方案下的經修訂資本標準而提出。諮詢文件亦包括就《資本規則》下有關官方實體集中風險的處理方法所作出的其他相應修訂。經修訂規則的目標實施日期將與落實《巴塞爾協定三》最終改革方案的經修訂《資本規則》中的信用風險部分的實施日期一致（即不早於2024年1月1日）。

# 流動性標準

金管局擬於2023年諮詢業界有關透過《2023年銀行業（流動性）（修訂）規則》（《2023年流動性修訂規則》）對《銀行業（流動性）規則》作出的建議修訂。相關修訂是因應同時期的《資本規則》建議修訂而作出，所以《2023年流動性修訂規則》的目標實施日期將與落實《巴塞爾協定三》最終改革方案的經修訂《資本規則》中的信用風險部分的實施日期一致（即不早於2024年1月1日）。

# 披露標準

《巴塞爾協定三》最終改革方案中與經修訂資本標準相關的新的及經修訂的披露規定，主要載於巴塞爾委員會分別於2018年12月及2021年11月發出的《第三支柱1 披露規定 — 更新框架》及《修訂市場風險披露規定》。巴塞爾委員會亦於2019年6月發出《修訂槓桿比率披露規定》，藉修訂槓桿比率的披露規定處理對潛在「粉飾櫥窗」（指銀行在報告日期前後減少某些交易的交易量，從而人為地提高報告及公開披露的槓桿比率）的關注。為在香港實施上述新的及經修訂的披露規定，金管局亦正擬備《銀行業（披露）規則》（《披露規則》）的相應修訂，以及經修訂後的標準披露模版及表格，並在過程中徵詢業界意見。預計《披露規則》的修訂將於2023年內連同《資本規則》的修訂一併提交立法會進行先訂立後審議程序。

<HONG KONG MONETARY AUTHORITY ANNUAL WORK PRIORITIES AND OUTLOOK>

Although Hong Kong's economy showed early signs of recovery in 2023, the external environment remained challenging and uncertain. Recent pressures on the banking sectors in the US and Europe, including the collapse of certain domestic US banks in March 2023, caused ripple effects across global financial markets. Tightening monetary policies by major central banks likely led to slower global economic growth or even recession in 2023. Meanwhile, ongoing geopolitical tensions and the threat of deglobalization may continue to hinder global trade and cause periodic volatility in global financial markets. Despite these challenges, Hong Kong's financial system has demonstrated robust resilience and sufficient buffer capacity built over years, enabling it to withstand adverse shocks effectively.

The HKMA places great importance on safeguarding currency and financial stability. Looking ahead, in the face of an uncertain macroeconomic environment, the HKMA will remain vigilant, striving to swiftly identify emerging risks and respond flexibly. At the same time, the HKMA will continue to seize opportunities and create policy space to further enhance Hong Kong's status as a leading international financial center. In this challenging investment environment, the HKMA will maintain prudent investment practices when managing the Exchange Fund, while retaining adequate flexibility to take defensive measures as needed and maintaining high liquidity.

<FINANCIAL SYSTEM MAINTAINS STABLE AND SOUND CONDITION>

Global economic prospects remain constrained by significant uncertainties. The HKMA will closely monitor developments, maintain vigilance, and prevent various potential risks to ensure the stability and soundness of the financial system. This is a prerequisite for continuously providing critical financial services and remains vital to sustaining normal operations of Hong Kong's economy.

<STAY ALERT TO POTENTIAL RISKS>

In 2023, uncertainty regarding future trends in US interest rates and pressures within banking systems of advanced economies could pose downside risks to growth prospects in major advanced economies. Additionally, persistent geo-political risks may continue to impede global trade and cause intermittent volatility in global financial markets. However, Hong Kong's financial system, backed by its long-established resilience and buffer capacity, has sufficient ability to withstand adverse shocks. The HKMA also possesses the capability, resources, and determination to maintain Hong Kong's currency and financial stability.

The HKMA will continue to closely monitor risks and vulnerabilities in both local and external environments, taking appropriate measures as needed to maintain the stability of Hong Kong's currency and financial system. The HKMA will also study matters affecting Hong Kong's economy and assess associated potential risks.

<MAINTAINING STABILITY OF THE BANKING SYSTEM>

Given escalating geopolitical tensions and major central banks' aggressive interest rate hikes to curb inflation, the operating environment for the banking sector is expected to remain challenging in 2023. On the other hand, rapid technological advancements and digitalization present both risks and opportunities for the banking industry. Facing the ever-changing financial landscape, the HKMA is committed to ensuring banks have sufficient capabilities to withstand shocks through continuous regulatory efforts. Simultaneously, the HKMA will refer to international standards and best practices to continue strengthening and optimizing bank regulatory frameworks and policies.

<RISK-BASED SUPERVISORY PRIORITY>

<CREDIT, LIQUIDITY, AND MARKET RISK>

In 2023, the HKMA will continue to closely monitor the asset quality of authorized institutions, focusing on their loan classification and provisioning practices, as well as the management of borrowers with weaker financial conditions. The HKMA will also enhance its monitoring systems and take proactive measures to ensure overall credit risk levels in the banking system remain under control.

Meanwhile, the HKMA will continue to pay attention to the business environment of enterprises and maintain close communication with the banking sector and the business community to prepare for the eventual withdrawal of the "Pre-approved Interest-only Payment Extension Scheme," while ensuring customers temporarily facing difficulties still receive appropriate credit support.

Additionally, given the uncertain macroeconomic environment, the HKMA will strengthen regulation of liquidity and market risk management for authorized institutions in 2023.

<OPERATIONAL AND TECHNOLOGY RISKS>

As banks increasingly apply technology in operational activities, the HKMA will strive to enhance the operational resilience and cybersecurity capabilities of the banking industry. Following the release of the new module "Operational Resilience" in May, the HKMA will maintain close contact with the industry to review progress made by authorized institutions in developing operational resilience frameworks. At the same time, the HKMA will improve the cybersecurity capabilities of the banking industry by following up on issues identified under the "Cybersecurity Assessment Framework 2.0" evaluation and reviewing progress on implementing robust triple data backup mechanisms.

With the acceleration of digitization, other regulatory priorities include strengthening oversight of third-party service providers for banks and enhancing data governance capabilities in the banking industry.

<COMBATING MONEY LAUNDERING AND TERRORIST FINANCE>

In 2023, the HKMA's priorities include updating regulatory information, strengthening collaboration among stakeholders in the anti-money laundering and terrorist financing (AML/CFT) ecosystem to address AML/CFT risks, and further promoting development of AML/CFT regulatory technology and compliance technology. The HKMA's "Guidelines on Combating Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing" will be revised, and specific guidance will be issued regarding proportionate measures against politically exposed persons (PEPs), thereby encouraging the industry to implement legislative revisions effectively and on a risk-based approach. At the same time, the HKMA will expand existing public-private partnerships to enhance information sharing, and support the launch of an inter-bank information-sharing platform to expedite detection of suspicious accounts and prevention of account misuse, while strengthening protection for victims of fraud and assistance in recovering losses. Through initiatives like the "AML Compliance Technology Lab" and other AML compliance technology projects, the HKMA will further promote adoption of compliance technologies (including data analytics) and work toward developing macro-level analytical capabilities to support its data-driven AML regulatory activities. By implementing these measures, the HKMA will be able to respond more rapidly to systemic money laundering risks such as shell account networks and flexibly address evolving threats.

<WELLNESS MANAGEMENT BUSINESS>

In 2023, the HKMA will strengthen on-site inspections and off-site supervision of authorized institutions concerning their conduct in wealth management and sales of securities, mandatory provident fund (MPF), and other investment and insurance products. The key focus areas for 2023 will be the Cross-border Wealth Management Connect scheme, digital distribution and advisory platforms, virtual assets, environmental, social, and governance (ESG) investment products, and long-term insurance products. During this process, the HKMA will refer to the latest market developments and revisions to international standards.

The HKMA will also maintain close communication with other regulators and the banking sector, providing guidance to authorized institutions on regulatory standards for selling investment, insurance, and MPF products, which will include guidelines on offering virtual asset-related investment services. Regarding this, to promote sustainable and responsible development of the virtual asset industry, the HKMA will actively participate in relevant international organizations and collaborate with the government and other financial regulators to establish a comprehensive virtual asset regulatory framework.

With the successful launch of the Cross-border Wealth Management Connect scheme, the HKMA will engage with the industry and relevant regulators to optimize the program. Additionally, the HKMA will cooperate with the Securities and Futures Commission (SFC) and the industry to streamline product sales processes (including those applicable to sophisticated investors), and begin regulating authorized institutions' trust business according to the new modules in the Regulatory Policy Manual and new operational codes.

<MONITORING FINANCIAL MARKET INFRASTRUCTURE>

The HKMA aims to promote safety and efficiency of its monitored financial market infrastructures in accordance with the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facility Ordinance (Payment Ordinance), the Principles for Financial Market Infrastructures (Infrastructure Principles), and various guidelines issued by the Payments and Financial Infrastructures Committee. The HKMA will assess each infrastructure as needed against the latest international standards. The HKMA will participate in the oversight and assessment programs of the Infrastructure Principles implementation conducted by the Payments and Financial Infrastructures Committee and the International Organization of Securities Commissions, as well as contribute to work by international standard-setting bodies and refer to international practices or enhance its own supervisory rules in response to market and technological developments. Where necessary, the HKMA will cooperate with relevant authorities to further strengthen coordinated supervision arrangements.

<FORMULATING POLICIES>

The HKMA will continue to enhance and optimize bank regulatory frameworks and policies in line with international standards and best practices.

<IMPLEMENTATION OF BASEL STANDARDS IN HONG KONG>

<CAPITAL STANDARDS>

The HKMA will further optimize the capital framework by implementing standards recently released by the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision (BCBS), including:
- Revised capital standards outlined in the 2017 December "Basel III: Finalisation of the Post-crisis Reforms", the January 2019 (February 2019 revised) "Minimum Capital Requirements for Market Risk", and July 2020 "Targeted Amendments to the Credit Valuation Adjustment Risk Framework"—these revised capital standards are collectively referred to as the "Finalising Basel III" reform package, which specifies new regulatory approaches for credit risk, market risk, credit valuation adjustment risk, and operational risk, introduces floor provisions, and optimizes the leverage ratio framework. After multiple rounds of industry consultation in 2022, the HKMA plans to initiate statutory consultation in 2023 on proposed amendments to the Banking (Capital) Rules ("Capital Rules") to implement these provisions and the counter-cyclically capital buffer. These amendments are expected to be submitted to the Legislative Council for the "enactment before review" procedure during the same year, and shall not come into effect earlier than January 1, 2024, as minimum requirements.
- The HKMA plans to implement the prudential treatment method for cryptoasset risk exposure set out in the December 2022 "Prudential Treatment of Cryptoasset Risk Exposure" according to the BCBS timeline, and intends to consult the industry on related proposals in 2023.

<RISK LIMITS>

In March 2023, the HKMA consulted the industry on proposed amendments to the Banking (Limits on Risk-taking) Rules. These proposed amendments mainly stem from the implementation of the revised capital standards under the aforementioned "Finalising Basel III" reform package. The consultation paper also includes other corresponding amendments regarding the handling of concentrated risk exposures of official entities under the Capital Rules. The target implementation date for the revised rules will align with the implementation date of the credit risk portion of the revised Capital Rules under the finalizing Basel III reform package (i.e., no earlier than January 1, 2024).

<LIQUIDITY STANDARDS>

The HKMA intends to consult the industry in 2023 regarding proposed amendments to the Banking (Liquidity) (Amendment) Rules (the "2023 Liquidity Amendment Rules") to the Banking (Liquidity) Rules. These amendments are in response to concurrent proposed amendments to the Capital Rules, so the target implementation date for the 2023 Liquidity Amendment Rules will coincide with the implementation date of the credit risk portion of the revised Capital Rules under the finalizing Basel III reform package (i.e., no earlier than January 1, 2024).

<DISCLOSURE STANDARDS>

New and amended disclosure requirements related to the revised capital standards under the "Finalising Basel III" reform package are primarily outlined in the Basel Committee's "Third Pillar 1 Disclosure Standards – Updated Framework" issued in December 2018 and "Revised Market Risk Disclosure Standards" issued in November 2021. The Basel Committee also issued "Revised Leverage Ratio Disclosure Standards" in June 2019 to address concerns about potential "window dressing" (referring to banks reducing certain transactions volume before and after reporting dates to artificially inflate reported and publicly disclosed leverage ratios). To implement these new and revised disclosure requirements in Hong Kong, the HKMA is also preparing corresponding amendments to the Banking (Disclosures) Rules ("Disclosure Rules"), as well as revised standard disclosure templates and forms, seeking industry input during the process. It is expected that the amendments to the Disclosure Rules will be submitted to the Legislative Council for the "enactment before review" procedure together with the Capital Rules amendments in 2023.

# 機構管治

金管局作為香港的中央銀行機構，深明良好的管治對維持及維護公眾對金管局履行其法定職責的信任及信心的重要性，因此一直致力秉持高水平的機構管治。

為實踐良好機構管治的承諾，金管局：
- 建立了一套清晰且具備高問責性的機構管治架構；
- 實施完善穩健的監控措施以管理風險，並確保所有職級員工的行為及其日常運作均符合指定標準；及
- 奉行具透明度及保持開放的政策，與各持份者保持緊密聯繫。

# 金管局與香港特別行政區政府

金管局是香港特別行政區政府（特區政府）架構的一部分，但可以按與公務員不同的聘用條款聘請員工，以吸引具適當經驗與專門知識的人才。金管局總裁及其員工均為公職人員。金管局的日常運作，在金融管理專員所獲賦予或轉授的法定權力範圍內高度自主。

財政司司長負責釐定香港的貨幣政策目標及貨幣體制：財政司司長於2003年6月25日致金融管理專員的函件中，訂明應透過貨幣發行局制度維持貨幣穩定，將港元匯率保持在約7.80港元兌1美元的水平。金融管理專員須自行負責達成貨幣政策目標，包括決定有關的策略、工具及執行方式，並負責維持香港貨幣制度的穩定與健全。

財政司司長在財經事務及庫務局局長的協助下，負責維持香港金融體系穩定與健全，以及保持香港的國際金融中心地位的政策。為推行這些政策，金融管理專員的職責包括：
- 促進銀行體系的整體穩定與有效運作；
- 與其他有關機構與組織合作，發展債務市場；
- 處理與法定紙幣及硬幣的發行及流通有關的事宜；
- 透過發展支付、結算及交收系統，以及在適當情況下負責操作有關系統，促進金融基建的安全與效率；及
- 與其他有關機構與組織合作，促進對香港貨幣及金融體系的信心，並推行適當的發展市場措施，以協助加強香港金融服務的國際競爭力。

外匯基金由財政司司長掌有控制權。金融管理專員須根據財政司司長轉授的權力，就外匯基金的運用及投資管理向財政司司長負責。

# 問責性與透明度

就日常運作及推行政府政策目標所採用的方法，金管局一直保持高度自主，並同時輔以高問責性及透明度。

金管局致力促進貨幣與銀行體系穩定，有效管理官方儲備，發展與監察穩健及多元化的金融基建，從而鞏固香港的國際金融中心地位，推動香港經濟發展。

金管局要有效履行職責，便必須取得社會人士的信任。因此，金管局以嚴謹的態度，履行向公眾解釋其政策及工作的責任，並盡力處理備受社會關注而涉及金管局職責範圍的事項。尤其，金管局透過傳統及社交媒體適時澄清有關金管局政策的失實資訊及謠言。

金融管理專員由財政司司長委任，因此金管局透過財政司司長向公眾負責；而由於金管局的職權由立法會通過的法律制訂，因此金管局亦透過立法會向公眾負責。金管局亦明白本身肩負更廣泛的責任，就是促進公眾對金管局角色及目標的認識，並密切留意社會人士所關注的事項。金管局在執行日常工作及與社會保持廣泛聯繫時，堅守盡力提高透明度及保持開放的政策。這項政策有兩大目標：
- 在顧及市場敏感性、商業秘密及機密資料披露的法定限制下，盡量使金融界及公眾充分了解金管局的工作；及
- 確保金管局掌握社會脈搏，並對公眾意見作出適當回應。

金管局在透明度方面致力達致國際最高標準，與傳媒保持廣泛聯繫之餘，亦出版各種中英文期刊及專題刊物。金管局的雙語網站(www.hkma.gov.hk)除有專門環節列載經濟研究、統計資料、監管資源、消費者資訊及其他課題外，還載有大量金管局出版的刊物、新聞稿、演辭及簡報會資料文件。此外，金管局又利用社交媒體平台，以能在數碼時代中更有效與公眾溝通。金管局辦事處設有資訊中心，分為圖書館及展覽館兩部分，每星期開放6日予公眾參觀及使用。有關金管局與公眾溝通及聯繫的工作，詳見「機構職能」一章（第157至162頁）。

金管局公布外匯基金及貨幣發行局帳目資料的次數，一直逐步增加，內容亦越趨詳細。金管局於1999年開始參與國際貨幣基金組織的中央銀行「數據公布特殊標準」計劃。金管局亦公布外匯基金諮詢委員會轄下貨幣發行委員會的會議紀錄，以及貨幣發行局制度運作報告。自1996年起，金管局網站載有銀行業監管政策及指引。

金管局與立法會的關係對提高問責性及透明度非常重要。金管局總裁承諾每年3次向立法會財經事務委員會簡報金管局各項工作及政策，並回答有關查詢。此外，金管局代表不時出席立法會事務委員會及小組委員會會議，闡釋及商討特別事項，以及協助議員審閱條例草案。

# 監控措施

金管局採用穩健有效的內部及外部監控機制，確保秉持高水平的員工操守、審慎的風險管理，以及適當的制衡。內部及外部審計職能就監控機制是否足夠及具成效提供獨立評估。

# 行為守則

《行為守則》就員工的道德與法律責任提供指引，確保所有職級員工的行為均符合指定標準。

# 內部監控

# 運作監控

作為風險管理的第一度防線，所有部門及分處均有責任評估其工作流程的風險，並制定適當的監控措施，確保金管局日常運作穩妥。

# 機構風險管理

風險管理亦在機構層面進行。由金管局總裁擔任主席的風險委員會，是機構風險管理架構的基石之一。

風險委員會審視和商討各部門所識別的潛在及新生風險，以及相關監控措施和緩解策略是否充足，並由該會定出適當的跟進行動。

# 內部審計

金管局內部審核處獨立評估不同部門的管治程序、風險管理及監控措施是否足夠及具成效，並提出改善建議。

# 外部審計

根據《外匯基金條例》第7條，外匯基金的財務報表由香港特區政府審計署審核。審計署並無就此項服務收取費用。經審核的外匯基金財務報表刊載於金管局《年報》。

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA), as Hong Kong’s central bank, recognizes the critical importance of sound institutional governance in maintaining and upholding public confidence in its ability to fulfill its statutory responsibilities. It has consistently committed itself to upholding high standards of institutional governance.
To fulfill its commitment to good institutional governance, the HKMA:
- Has established a clear and accountable institutional governance framework;
- Implements robust monitoring mechanisms to manage risks and ensure that the behavior and daily operations of staff at all levels comply with specified standards; and
- Maintains transparent policies and close communication with stakeholders.

<HKMA_and_Hong_Kong_Government>
As part of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (HKSAR) Government structure, the HKMA can employ personnel under different appointment terms than those applicable to civil servants, thereby attracting individuals with suitable experience and expertise. The Chief Executive of the HKMA and its employees are considered public officers. The HKMA operates with a high degree of autonomy within the scope of the statutory powers granted or delegated to the Financial Secretary.

The Financial Secretary is responsible for determining Hong Kong's monetary policy objectives and the monetary system. In a letter dated 25 June 2003 addressed to the Chief Executive of the HKMA, the Financial Secretary stipulated that monetary stability should be maintained through the Currency Board Arrangement, keeping the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate at approximately HKD 7.80 to USD 1. The Chief Executive of the HKMA is solely responsible for achieving these monetary policy goals, including deciding on related strategies, tools, and implementation methods, and ensuring the stability and soundness of Hong Kong's monetary system.

Under the assistance of the Secretary for Financial Affairs and Treasury, the Financial Secretary oversees the maintenance of a stable and sound financial system, as well as policies aimed at preserving Hong Kong's status as an international financial centre. To implement these policies, the Chief Executive of the HKMA is responsible for:
- Promoting the overall stability and effective operation of the banking system;
- Collaborating with relevant authorities and organizations to develop the debt market;
- Managing matters relating to the issuance and circulation of legal tender notes and coins;
- Enhancing the safety and efficiency of financial infrastructure by developing payment, settlement, and clearing systems, and operating them when necessary; and
- Cooperating with relevant authorities and organizations to foster confidence in Hong Kong's currency and financial system, and implementing appropriate market development initiatives to strengthen Hong Kong's competitiveness in financial services globally.

The Exchange Fund is under the control of the Financial Secretary. The Chief Executive of the HKMA is accountable to the Financial Secretary regarding the utilization and investment management of the Exchange Fund based on the powers delegated by the Financial Secretary.

<Accountability_and_Transparency>
In carrying out its day-to-day operations and executing government policy objectives, the HKMA maintains a high level of autonomy alongside strong accountability and transparency.

The HKMA is committed to promoting monetary and banking system stability, effectively managing official reserves, and developing and supervising a resilient and diversified financial infrastructure, thereby reinforcing Hong Kong's position as an international financial centre and driving economic growth.

To fulfill its duties effectively, the HKMA must earn the trust of the public. Therefore, it addresses its responsibility to explain its policies and activities to the public and carefully manages issues of public concern within its mandate. In particular, the HKMA clarifies misinformation and rumors about its policies through traditional and social media platforms in a timely manner.

The Chief Executive of the HKMA is appointed by the Financial Secretary, making the HKMA accountable to the public via the Financial Secretary. As the HKMA's authority is established by legislation passed by the Legislative Council, it is also accountable to the public through the Legislative Council. The HKMA understands that it bears broader responsibilities, namely, promoting public awareness of its role and objectives and closely monitoring societal concerns. While performing daily tasks and maintaining broad community engagement, the HKMA adheres to a policy of maximizing transparency and openness. This policy has two main objectives:
- To ensure the financial sector and the public have comprehensive understanding of the HKMA's work, where possible, while considering market sensitivity, commercial confidentiality, and legal restrictions on disclosure of sensitive information; and
- To enable the HKMA to gauge public sentiment and respond appropriately to public opinions.

The HKMA strives to achieve international best practices in transparency, maintaining extensive contact with the media while publishing various bilingual journals and special publications. The HKMA's bilingual website (www.hkma.gov.hk) features dedicated sections covering economic research, statistics, regulatory resources, consumer information, and other topics, along with a wide range of published materials, press releases, speeches, and briefing documents. Additionally, the HKMA utilizes social media platforms to communicate more effectively with the public in the digital age. The HKMA's offices include an information center divided into a library and exhibition hall, open six days a week for public visits and usage. Details of the HKMA's communication and engagement efforts with the public are provided in the "Institutional Functions" chapter (pages 157–162).

The frequency of the HKMA's disclosures regarding the accounts and operational details of the Exchange Fund has been gradually increasing, with greater detail in recent years. Since 1999, the HKMA has participated in the IMF's Data Standards Initiatives for Central Banks. The HKMA also publishes meeting records of the Currency Board Committee under the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee and reports on the functioning of the Currency Board Arrangement. Since 1996, the HKMA's website has featured banking regulation policies and guidelines.

The relationship between the HKMA and the Legislative Council is crucial for enhancing accountability and transparency. The Chief Executive of the HKMA commits to providing three briefings annually to the Financial Services and Insurance Committee of the Legislative Council on the HKMA's operations and policies, answering relevant inquiries. Furthermore, HKMA representatives regularly attend meetings of legislative committees and subcommittees to discuss and clarify specific issues, assisting legislators in reviewing draft bills.

<monitoring_mechanisms>
The HKMA employs robust and effective internal and external monitoring mechanisms to ensure high-level employee conduct, prudent risk management, and appropriate controls. Internal and external audit functions provide independent assessments of whether the monitoring mechanisms are adequate and effective.

<code_of_conduct>
The Code of Conduct provides guidance on the ethical and legal responsibilities of staff, ensuring that the behavior of all staff members meets specified standards.

<inner_supervision>
<operational_supervision>
As the first line of defense in risk management, all departments and divisions are responsible for assessing the risks of their operational processes and implementing appropriate monitoring measures to ensure the smooth daily operations of the HKMA.

<institutional_risk_management>
Risk management is also conducted at the institutional level. The Risk Committee, chaired by the Chief Executive of the HKMA, serves as one of the cornerstones of the institutional risk management framework.

The Risk Committee reviews and discusses potential and emerging risks identified by various departments, as well as the adequacy of related monitoring measures and mitigation strategies, and determines appropriate follow-up actions.

<internal_auditing>
The Internal Audit Division of the HKMA independently assesses whether the governance procedures, risk management, and monitoring measures of different departments are sufficient and effective, and offers recommendations for improvement.

<external_auditing>
According to Article 7 of the Exchange Fund Ordinance, the financial statements of the Exchange Fund are audited by the Office of the Auditor General of the HKSAR Government. No fees are charged for this service. Audited financial statements of the Exchange Fund are included in the HKMA's Annual Report.

# 經濟及金融環境

面對第五波新冠病毒疫情、金融狀況收緊及充滿挑戰的外圍環境，香港經濟在2022年顯著收縮。勞工市場持續一段時間轉差，其後逐步改善，而通脹則維持溫和。資產市場亦有所受壓。受惠於內地與香港全面通關，預計2023年香港經濟增長將由低位復甦。

# 經濟回顧

# 實體經濟活動

受本地及外圍環境各項不利因素拖累，香港經濟在2022年收縮3.5%（表1及圖1）。本地方面，由於香港爆發第五波新冠病毒疫情，私人消費在第1季急跌，其後受惠於社交距離措施逐步放寬及政府消費券計劃的刺激，私人消費再度錄得按季增長。在營商氣氛疲弱及金融狀況收緊下，整體投資支出較2021年顯著下跌。對外方面，隨着外部需求轉弱，加上內地與香港之間的跨境陸路貨運受阻，香港貨物出口下挫。服務輸出依然大致疲弱，部分反映訪港旅遊活動低迷，但其後隨着政府於9月下旬撤銷抵港強制檢疫要求，情況於第4季稍為改善。

圖1 組成部分對實質本地生產總值增長的貢獻
資料來源：政府統計處

表 1 按開支項目計的實質本地生產總值增長（比對上期）
註：經季節性調整的本地固定資本形成總額按季增減幅度不詳。
資料來源：政府統計處

# 通脹

本地通脹壓力於2022年稍升，但仍屬溫和。具體而言，按年基本通脹率逐步上升至12月2%的溫和水平，其中外圍能源及食品價格高企的影響部分被溫和的本地成本壓力所抵銷，尤其是偏軟的房屋租金（圖2）。此外，在經濟活動疲弱下，名義工資增長及商業樓宇租金持續偏軟，亦有助遏抑通脹。2022年全年合計，基本及整體通脹率分別為1.7%及1.9%。

# 勞工市場

疫情下勞工市場狀況在2022年初急速惡化，但隨後持續改善。失業率在4月升至5.4%的高位後，於12月顯著回落至3.5%（圖3），當中大多數行業的失業率均有所下降。總就業人數（圖3）及私營機構職位空缺回升，反映整體勞工需求逐步回復，惟總就業人數仍低於疫情前水平。名義工資和勞工收入的按年升幅亦略為加快。另一方面，與去年同期比較，勞動人口於12月略為減少1.5%，部分原因是勞動人口參與率輕微下跌。

圖2 基本消費物價通脹
資料來源：政府統計處及金管局職員估計數字

圖3 勞工市場狀況
資料來源：政府統計處

# 股市

本港股市在2022年出現大幅波動。承接2021年的下行趨勢，恒生指數加速下跌，在2022年10月31日收報14,687點，是自2009年以來的最低水平（圖4）。股市顯著調整，最初是由市場對本地新冠病毒疫情、美國加息及俄烏局勢的憂慮加劇所觸發，其後由於環球金融狀況收緊及內地新冠病毒疫情導致環球經濟前景轉差，令股市調整幅度進一步擴大。股市在年內最後兩個月重拾一些上升動力，部分受到內地優化防疫抗疫措施所支持。恒生指數於年底收報19,781點，較2021年底顯著下跌15.5%，連續第三年下挫。

# 物業市場

在金融狀況收緊及經濟活動疲弱下，住宅物業市場亦有所受壓。樓價於2022年回落15%（圖4），成交量也大幅縮減39%至45,050宗，創下有紀錄以來的新低。儘管樓價下跌，置業負擔能力仍然偏緊。實際按揭利率於年內由約1.6厘上升至3.375至3.625厘，增加供樓人士的按揭供款負擔。非住宅物業市場亦進一步回軟。在空置率高企下，其價格有所回落，租金亦維持偏軟。

圖4 資產價格
資料來源：差餉物業估價署及香港交易及結算所有限公司

# 經濟前景

# 經濟環境

受惠於內地與香港全面通關，預期2023年香港經濟增長將由低位復甦。儘管先進經濟體增長預期放緩將繼續拖累香港貨物出口，但內地經濟復甦及跨境陸路貨運限制撤銷，應能為本港經濟提供支持。內地與香港全面通關亦有望令香港入境旅遊及其他服務輸出顯著受惠，並提振本地營商氣氛及資本開支。私人消費亦將會在勞工市場轉強下進一步改善。政府預測2023年全年實質本地生產總值會顯著增長，介乎3.5至5.5%。然而，香港經濟增長前景仍受眾多風險及不明朗因素所影響，並很大程度上取決於美國聯邦儲備局政策利率走勢、全球增長前景、地緣政治局勢持續緊張以及本地入境旅遊的復甦步伐。

# 通脹及勞工市場

展望未來，預期本地通脹將輕微上升，但在各種因素互相抵銷下應保持溫和。儘管外圍價格應會維持高企，但由於部分主要經濟體的經濟活動轉弱及商品價格上行壓力緩和，外圍價格的上升動力或會進一步減弱。同樣地，隨着本地經濟復甦及勞工市場改善，本地成本壓力或會輕微上升，但房屋租金偏軟應繼續在一定程度上抵銷其影響。政府預測2023年全年合計的整體及基本通脹率分別為2.9%及2.5%。另一方面，勞工市場狀況有望隨着本地經濟活動復常而進一步改善。

# 銀行體系表現

香港銀行體系在2022年面對充滿挑戰的宏觀經濟環境，包括年初爆發第五波新冠病毒疫情、地緣政治局勢升溫，以及全球各大央行大幅度加息應對通脹上升等。面對各項挑戰，香港銀行應付裕如，資本及流動性狀況繼續保持充裕。年內銀行體系面對的信貸風險增加，但整體資產質素維持於健康水平。與此同時，利率上升促使銀行淨利息收入增加，但其正面影響因呆壞帳準備金增加及費用與佣金收入減少而被局部抵銷。整體而言，零售銀行盈利較2021年改善。

# 資產質素

銀行體系的特定分類貸款比率由2021年底的0.89%上升至2022年底的1.38%，逾期及經重組貸款比率於同期由0.56%升至0.85%（圖5）。中國內地相關貸款的特定分類貸款比率於2022年底為2.21%，亦較2021年底的0.89%上升。特定分類貸款比率上升，主要是由於部分內地房地產發展商的貸款評級被下調。儘管如此，銀行撥備充足，截至2022年底，銀行信貸撥備覆蓋率（即信貸撥備和特定分類貸款比率）約維持於80%。若將抵押品變現價值從呆壞帳餘額中扣除，銀行信貸撥備覆蓋率約140%。另一方面，2022年底住宅按揭貸款及信用卡貸款的拖欠比率仍然處於低位，分別為0.06%及0.23%（圖6）。

圖5 銀行體系的資產質素
註：數字涵蓋香港辦事處、境外分行及境外主要附屬公司。
資料來源：金管局

資料來源：金管局

# 盈利走勢

銀行體系在2022年繼續錄得盈利。年內零售銀行的整體除稅前經營溢利上升19.0%（圖7）。盈利改善是受惠於淨利息收入（+34%）及外匯與衍生工具收入增加（+72%），但部分升幅被呆壞帳準備金增加（+151%）及費用與佣金收入減少（–19%）所抵銷。在加息環境下，淨息差由上一年的0.98%擴闊至2022年的1.31%（圖8）。年內市場波動增加，亦令銀行來自外匯及衍生工具業務的收入增加。呆壞帳準備金增加是由於須為新的特定分類貸款預留特殊準備金，而在金融市場表現疲弱下，費用及佣金收入減少。零售銀行成本與收入比率由2021年的54.7%，降至2022年的48.0%（圖9）。

圖7 零售銀行的表現
資料來源：金管局

圖8 零售銀行淨息差
資料來源：金管局

圖9 零售銀行成本與收入比率
資料來源：金管局

# 資產負債表走勢

2022年銀行體系資產負債表擴大2.5%。資產上升是由於外匯及衍生工具持倉按市價計值增加。面對外圍不明朗因素及利率趨升，年內貸款需求減弱。相比2021年錄得3.8%的增幅，2022年貸款總額減少3.0%。其中在香港境外使用的貸款減少10.2%，貿易融資減少13.5%，在香港使用的貸款則稍增0.9%。中國內地相關貸款繼2021年增長3.7%後，於2022年減少4.4%。

在資產負債表的負債方面，銀行體系存款繼續錄得溫和增長。存款總額於2022年增加1.7%，相比2021年的增幅為4.6%。由於貸款總額減少而存款總額增加，整體貸存比率由2021年底的71.8%稍降至2022年底的68.5%（圖10）。

# 資本充足水平

銀行在2022年的資本狀況維持充裕。2022年底本地註冊認可機構的綜合總資本比率為20.1%，相比上一年為20.2%；一級資本比率為18.1%（圖11）。兩者均遠高於相關國際最低要求。《巴塞爾協定三》槓桿比率於2022年底為7.9%（圖12）。

# 流動性狀況

銀行體系的流動性狀況繼續維持穩健，成為在宏觀經濟環境不明朗因素加劇下的重要支柱。第1類機構的季度平均流動性覆蓋比率在2022年第4季為162.3%，第2類機構的季度平均流動性維持比率為63.2%（圖13）。銀行體系的主要資金來源仍然是客戶存款。於2022年底，第1類機構的穩定資金淨額比率及第2A類機構的核心資金比率分別為137.7%及155.7%（圖14）。以上所有4個比率均遠高於法定最低要求。

# Economic and Financial Environment

Faced with the fifth wave of the novel coronavirus outbreak, tightened financial conditions, and a challenging external environment, Hong Kong's economy experienced a significant contraction in 2022. The labor market remained weak for some time before gradually improving, while inflation remained moderate. Asset markets also faced pressure. With the full resumption of travel between mainland China and Hong Kong, it is expected that Hong Kong's economic growth will recover from its low level in 2023.

# Economic Review

# Real Economic Activity

Due to various adverse factors both locally and externally, Hong Kong's economy contracted by 3.5% in 2022 (Table 1 and Figure 1). Locally, due to the爆发 of the fifth wave of the novel coronavirus outbreak, private consumption declined sharply in Q1, followed by a recovery in private consumption driven by the gradual relaxation of social distancing measures and the government's consumer voucher scheme. Under weak business sentiment and tightened financial conditions, total investment expenditure showed a significant decline compared to 2021. Externally, with weakening external demand and disruptions in cross-border land freight between mainland China and Hong Kong, Hong Kong's goods exports declined. Service exports remained largely weak, partly reflecting the sluggish tourism activities in Hong Kong, but improved slightly in Q4 following the government's cancellation of mandatory quarantine requirements for arrivals in late September.

Source: Census and Statistics Department

Source: Census and Statistics Department

# Inflation

Local inflation pressures rose slightly in 2022 but remained moderate. Specifically, the annual core inflation rate gradually increased to a moderate level of 2% in December, with the impact of high foreign energy and food prices partially offset by mild local cost pressures, particularly soft housing rents (Figure 2). Additionally, with weak economic activity, nominal wage growth and commercial rent continued to be soft, further helping to contain inflation. Throughout 2022, the core and overall inflation rates were 1.7% and 1.9%, respectively.

# Labor Market

The labor market situation deteriorated rapidly in early 2022 under the pandemic, but subsequently continued to improve. The unemployment rate peaked at 5.4% in April before declining significantly to 3.5% in December (Figure 3), with unemployment rates falling across most industries. Total employment (Figure 3) and job vacancies in the private sector rebounded, reflecting a gradual recovery in overall labor demand, although total employment still remained below pre-pandemic levels. Year-on-year increases in nominal wages and labor income also slightly accelerated. Meanwhile, compared to the same period last year, the labor force decreased by 1.5% in December, partly due to a slight decline in the labor force participation rate.

Figure 2 Core Consumer Price Inflation
Source: Census and Statistics Department and HKMA staff estimates

Figure 3 Labor Market Conditions
Source: Census and Statistics Department

# Stock Market

Hong Kong's stock market experienced significant volatility in 2022. Following the downward trend from 2021, the Hang Seng Index accelerated its decline and closed at 14,687 points on October 31, 2022, the lowest level since 2009 (Figure 4). The significant market correction was initially triggered by heightened concerns over the local novel coronavirus outbreak, U.S. interest rate hikes, and the Russia-Ukraine conflict. Subsequently, the market correction widened further due to tighter global financial conditions and deteriorating global economic outlooks caused by the novel coronavirus outbreak in mainland China. In the last two months of the year, the market regained some upward momentum, partly supported by mainland China's optimization of epidemic prevention and control measures. The Hang Seng Index closed at 19,781 points at year-end, down 15.5% from the end of 2021, marking the third consecutive year of decline.

# Property Market

Under the backdrop of tightened financial conditions and weak economic activity, the residential property market also faced pressure. Property prices dropped by 15% in 2022 (Figure 4), while transactions plummeted by 39% to 45,050 deals, setting a record low. Although property prices declined, housing affordability remained tight. The actual mortgage interest rates increased from around 1.6% during the year to 3.375 to 3.625 percent, increasing mortgage payment burdens for homeowners. The non-residential property market further softened. With high vacancy rates, prices declined and rental rates remained weak.

Figure 4 Asset Prices
Source: Rating and Valuation Office and Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing Limited

# Economic Outlook

# Economic Environment

With the full resumption of travel between mainland China and Hong Kong, it is expected that Hong Kong's economy will recover from its low level in 2023. Despite the continued drag on Hong Kong's goods exports from slowing growth expectations in advanced economies, mainland China's economic recovery and the removal of cross-border land freight restrictions should support Hong Kong's economy. The full resumption of travel between mainland China and Hong Kong is also expected to bring significant benefits to Hong Kong's inbound tourism and other service exports, boosting the local business environment and capital expenditures. Private consumption is expected to further improve with a stronger labor market. The government forecasts that real GDP will grow substantially in 2023, ranging from 3.5% to 5.5%. However, Hong Kong's economic growth prospects remain subject to numerous risks and uncertainties, largely depending on the trajectory of the U.S. Federal Reserve's policy interest rates, global growth prospects, sustained geopolitical tensions, and the pace of recovery in inbound tourism.

# Inflation and Labor Market

Looking ahead, local inflation is expected to rise slightly but will remain moderate against the backdrop of offsetting factors. While foreign price levels are expected to remain elevated, the downward trend in economic activity in some major economies and easing commodity price pressures may further weaken the upward momentum of foreign prices. Similarly, as the local economy recovers and the labor market improves, local cost pressures may rise slightly, but the softness in housing rents should continue to mitigate this effect to some extent. The government projects that the overall and core inflation rates for the entire year of 2023 will be 2.9% and 2.5%, respectively. Meanwhile, labor market conditions are expected to further improve with the normalization of local economic activities.

# Performance of the Banking System

Hong Kong's banking system faced a challenging macroeconomic environment in 2022, including the fifth wave of the novel coronavirus outbreak at the beginning of the year, rising geopolitical tensions, and large-scale interest rate hikes by major central banks to combat inflation. Despite these challenges, Hong Kong's banks managed well, with capital and liquidity positions remaining ample. Throughout the year, credit risks facing the banking system increased, but overall asset quality maintained a healthy level. At the same time, rising interest rates led to an increase in net interest income for banks, although this positive impact was partially offset by higher provisions for bad debts and reduced fee and commission income. Overall, retail banking profits improved compared to 2021.

# Asset Quality

The specific classification loan ratio of the banking system rose from 0.89% at the end of 2021 to 1.38% at the end of 2022, while the overdue and restructured loan ratio increased from 0.56% to 0.85% during the same period (Figure 5). The specific classification loan ratio for loans related to mainland China stood at 2.21% at the end of 2022, up from 0.89% at the end of 2021. The increase in the specific classification loan ratio was primarily due to the downgrade of loan ratings for some mainland real estate developers. Nevertheless, banks had sufficient provisions, with the coverage ratio of credit provisions relative to the specific classification loan ratio standing at approximately 80% as of the end of 2022. If the fair value of collateral is deducted from the bad debt balance, the coverage ratio of credit provisions would be about 140%. Meanwhile, the delinquency rates for residential mortgages and credit card loans remained at low levels at the end of 2022, at 0.06% and 0.23%, respectively (Figure 6).

# Profitability Trends

The banking system continued to record profits in 2022. During the year, the overall pre-tax operating profit of retail banking increased by 19.0% (Figure 7). The improvement in profitability was attributed to an increase in net interest income (+34%) and additional income from foreign exchange and derivative instruments (+72%), partially offset by higher provisions for bad debts (+151%) and reduced fee and commission income (-19%). Under the interest rate hike environment, the net interest margin expanded from 0.98% in the previous year to 1.31% in 2022 (Figure 8). Increased market volatility during the year also contributed to higher income from foreign exchange and derivative operations. The rise in provisions for bad debts was due to the need to set aside special provisions for new specific classification loans, while reduced fee and commission income resulted from the weak performance of financial markets. The cost-to-income ratio for retail banking declined from 54.7% in 2021 to 48.0% in 2022 (Figure 9).

# Balance Sheet Trends

The banking system's balance sheet expanded by 2.5% in 2022. Asset growth was driven by increases in foreign exchange and derivative holdings valued at market prices. Amid uncertain external conditions and rising interest rates, loan demand weakened throughout the year. Compared to the 3.8% increase recorded in 2021, total loans decreased by 3.0% in 2022. Loans used outside Hong Kong decreased by 10.2%, trade financing decreased by 13.5%, while loans used within Hong Kong saw a slight increase of 0.9%. Loans related to mainland China, which grew by 3.7% in 2021, decreased by 4.4% in 2022.

On the liability side of the balance sheet, bank deposits continued to show moderate growth. Total deposits increased by 1.7% in 2022, compared to a 4.6% increase in 2021. As total loans decreased while deposits increased, the overall loan-to-deposit ratio declined slightly from 71.8% at the end of 2021 to 68.5% at the end of 2022 (Figure 10).

# Capital Adequacy Levels

Bank capital adequacy remained strong in 2022. At the end of 2022, the consolidated total capital ratio of locally licensed authorized institutions was 20.1%, compared to 20.2% in the previous year; the Tier 1 capital ratio was 18.1% (Figure 11). # Currency Stability

With the US tightening its monetary policy, the Hong Kong dollar weakened in 2022, triggering the weak exchange rate mechanism 41 times between May and November. With increased trading volume in the local stock market and seasonal funding demands at year-end, the Hong Kong dollar strengthened beginning mid-November. Under the Linked Exchange Rate System, Hong Kong interbank offered rates generally followed the trend of US interbank offered rates. Due to continuous US interest rate hikes, Hong Kong interbank offered rates gradually increased throughout 2022. Overall, the foreign exchange and money markets remained stable and well-functioning. As the cornerstone of Hong Kong's monetary and financial stability, the Linked Exchange Rate System has consistently demonstrated strong resilience against external shocks.

# Objectives

The primary objective of Hong Kong's monetary policy is to maintain currency stability, ensuring the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate remains within the range of HKD7.75 to HKD7.85 per US dollar. This currency system primarily adopts the Currency Board arrangement, stipulating that the US dollar reserves held by the Exchange Fund must provide full coverage for the monetary base. Any changes in the monetary base must be accompanied by corresponding increases or decreases in US dollar reserves, fully matching the variations in the monetary base.

The monetary base (Table 1) comprises:
- Certificates of Indebtedness (fully supporting banknotes issued by the three authorized banks);
- Circulating notes and coins issued by the Government;
- Total settlement balances held in the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's (HKMA) accounts (i.e., total reserves); and
- Foreign Exchange Fund bills and bonds issued by the HKMA on behalf of the Government.

The HKMA maintains the stability of the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate through its automatic interest rate adjustment mechanism and firm commitment to fulfilling the exchange guarantee. When the strong (or weak) exchange rate mechanism is triggered, the HKMA will sell HKD and buy USD (or buy HKD and sell USD) at HKD7.75 per USD (or HKD7.85 per USD) upon request from banks, increasing (or decreasing) total reserves, thus lowering (or raising) HKD interest rates to bring the HKD exchange rate back within the HKD7.75-HKD7.85 band.

# 2022 Review

# Exchange Rate Stability

Affected by local stock market adjustments, expectations of further US interest rate hikes, and carry trade activities driven by negative interest rate differentials between Hong Kong and London interbank offered rates, the Hong Kong dollar weakened at the start of 2022 and remained close to the weak exchange rate level in subsequent months. The weak exchange rate mechanism was triggered 41 times between May and November. With increased trading volume in the local stock market and seasonal funding demands at year-end, the Hong Kong dollar began strengthening mid-November (Figure 1). Overall, the Hong Kong dollar foreign exchange market continued operating normally throughout 2022.

To meet ongoing demand for Foreign Exchange Fund bills, the HKMA issued HK$40 billion worth of Foreign Exchange Fund bills at the beginning of 2022. Additionally, the HKMA purchased HK$242.1 billion at the weak exchange rate level between May and November 2022, according to the design of the Linked Exchange Rate System. Total reserves decreased from HK$377.5 billion at the end of 2021 to HK$96.3 billion at the end of 2022, reflecting the effects of issuing Foreign Exchange Fund bills and activating the weak exchange rate mechanism. Meanwhile, the total amount of outstanding Foreign Exchange Fund bills and bonds increased slightly from HK$1,148.8 billion to HK$1,200.4 billion during the year. Therefore, the combined total of total reserves and outstanding Foreign Exchange Fund bills and bonds decreased from HK$1,526.3 billion at the end of 2021 to HK$1,296.7 billion at the end of 2022 (Figure 2). The monetary base remained fully supported by foreign exchange reserves.

Figure 1 2022 Market Exchange Rates

Figure 2 Total Reserves (before Discount Window Activities) and Outstanding Foreign Exchange Fund Bills and Bonds, 2022

# Money Market

Under the linked exchange rate system, Hong Kong interbank offered rates generally followed the trend of US interbank offered rates. Due to continuous US interest rate hikes in 2022, Hong Kong interbank offered rates gradually increased (Figure 3). Over the year, overnight, one-month, and three-month Hong Kong interbank offered rates rose by 318, 419, and 473 basis points respectively to 3.23%, 4.35%, and 4.99% at year-end.

In response to the Federal Funds rate target range increase, the benchmark interest rate was raised seven times, totaling 425 basis points (4.25 percentage points), rising from 0.5% to 4.75% (Figure 3). At the retail level, with the US policy rate increases, several banks raised their prime lending rates by 12.5 basis points in late September, another 25 basis points in early November, and a further 25 basis points in mid-December. Some banks also increased the upper limits of new mortgage rates based on Hong Kong interbank offered rates during the year. Overall, the Hong Kong money market continued functioning normally. Discount window loans increased from HK$6.8 billion in 2021 to HK$8.4 billion in 2022.

Figure 3 Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rates, 2022

# Linked Exchange Rate System

Over nearly four decades, the linked exchange rate system has been a critical pillar of Hong Kong's financial system, demonstrating strong capacity to cope with challenges. Despite the fluctuating global financial conditions in 2022, the Hong Kong dollar foreign exchange and money markets maintained orderly operations, reflecting the sound and effective nature of the linked exchange rate system. The government has steadfastly maintained the linked exchange rate system. In its "2022 Article IV Consultation Report," the International Monetary Fund reiterated that Hong Kong possesses transparent rules, substantial fiscal and foreign exchange reserves, a robust financial regulatory and supervisory framework, a flexible economy, and prudent fiscal arrangements, ensuring the credibility of the linked exchange rate system.

A sound banking system is critical for the normal operation of the linked exchange rate system. Hong Kong's banking system continued to function smoothly, with liquidity and capital positions being extremely ample relative to international standards. To ensure the banking system's ability to withstand shocks, the HKMA has continuously monitored banks' credit, liquidity, and interest rate risk management, as well as stress test results, and maintained oversight of bank lending.

To enhance transparency of the Currency Board accounts, since October 1998, part of the assets of the Exchange Fund have been designated to support the monetary base. The support ratio (the ratio of supporting assets to the monetary base) fluctuated between 109.3% and 111.0% in 2022, without touching the upper or lower limits. The ratio closed at 110.1% on December 31 (Figure 4). Under the linked exchange rate system, although certain Exchange Fund assets have been designated as supporting portfolios, all Exchange Fund assets remain available to support the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate. The substantial financial resources of the Exchange Fund, along with Hong Kong's sound banking system, provide a strong foundation for safeguarding Hong Kong's monetary and financial stability.

Figure 4 Daily Fluctuations in Support Ratio, 2022

# Currency Issuance Committee

The Currency Issuance Committee under the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee is responsible for monitoring and discussing issues related to Hong Kong's currency and financial stability. # 銀行體系穩定

儘管宏觀環境充滿不確定性及挑戰，加上金融市場異常波動，香港銀行體系於2022年維持穩健。年內金管局亦加強對認可機構信用及市場風險管理的監管。此外，鑑於網絡威脅持續增加及銀行業數碼轉型步伐加快，金管局與認可機構緊密合作，提升認可機構的運作穩健性及網絡防衛能力。

操守監管方面，金管局加強有關「先買後付」產品的消費者保障，並就物業轉按交易提供多一種支付安排。金管局又與其他監管機構合作，就虛擬資產的可持續發展制定監管架構，精簡投資產品銷售程序，以及推出全新的信託業務監管制度。年內有關個人信貸資料的「多間信貸資料服務機構」模式下的「信貸資料平台」啟用，並推出新的強制性背景查核計劃，以應對「滾動的壞蘋果」現象。此外，面對因疫情而實施的旅遊限制，金管局協助推出便利措施讓客戶重新啟動銀行戶口。

因應最新的香港洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集風險評估，金管局與銀行透過公私營夥伴合作（包括反訛騙及洗黑錢情報工作組），鞏固香港的打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集生態圈，以及加強應對騙案。此外，金管局亦與策略夥伴合作，以能更充分了解及有效管理日益複雜的地緣政治環境所帶來的風險及不穩定因素。金管局又透過「反洗錢合規科技實驗室」系列進一步推動業界運用數據及科技，並同時加快金管局在反洗錢工作中採用監管科技的步伐。在國際事務方面，金管局積極參與財務行動特別組織的工作。

在2022年，本地就有關資本充足標準及披露標準等國際監管標準的實施上取得良好進展。此外，金管局亦大力提升業界的軟實力，包括與銀行業合作建立可持續的人才儲備，以及提升現有從業員的技能。年內金管局一直與銀行業緊密合作，改進及精簡監管政策與程序。

金管局亦繼續致力推進在本地及國際層面的工作，以確保香港備有具公信力的處置機制。具體工作包括制定新處置標準；進行地區危機模擬演習，以及在所有具本地系統重要性銀行建立一層新的吸收虧損能力資源，標誌着金管局在提升處置可行性上立下里程碑。

# 目標

金管局的整體目標之一是促進銀行體系的安全及穩定。要達致這個目標，實有賴建立及維持具高度應對能力且能為香港經濟提供所需關鍵金融服務的金融體系。

銀行可能因營運方式，甚或在極端情況下因失序地倒閉而影響銀行體系的穩定。作為監管當局，金融管理專員在保障金融穩定方面擔當重要角色，確保銀行有能力抵禦衝擊及應對危機恢復常態，以最終有助防止出現倒閉。金融管理專員負責對銀行進行審慎監管，以及認可香港的持牌銀行、有限制牌照銀行及接受存款公司（統稱「認可機構」）。

香港的審慎監管制度並非為確保「零風險」而設。作為其中一個處置機制當局，金融管理專員力求確保一旦有認可機構不再可持續經營，能有秩序地處理其倒閉。為此，香港已設立金融機構處置機制，金融管理專員在該機制下為認可機構（以及其他類型機構）的處置機制當局。為落實香港的處置機制，有必要制定處置規則及政策標準、進行處置規劃以排除認可機構處置可行性的障礙，以及建立金管局處置瀕臨倒閉認可機構的運作能力。為有效執行上述工作，金管局採納與國際一致及協調的方法。

金融管理專員亦負責指定及監察某些金融市場基建。金管局監察金融市場基建的目的，是促進有關基建的整體安全及效率、控制系統性風險，以及提高透明度。提升金融市場基建的抗震能力，能保障香港的貨幣與金融體系，避免因金融市場基建運作中斷而可能影響其穩定。
